instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 liquid damaga
threads.message:
Hi all,

got a MacBook in minor liquid damage
a minor drop on C7797 and c7796
and a small drop on the ssd.
rest of the board is absolutly perfect no spills.

now i cleaned the replaced the 2 caps board runs no issues.

the SSD was not reconized so i replaced a cop that had damage
now it gets reconized but is real slow.
and also heats up alot and i mean like almost cant put your finger on the ssd (the complete SSD is hot not just a part)

i then swaped the SSD, and also the other SSD gets the same temp.

is that normal for a SSD to get hot?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 liquid damaga
threads.message: SSDs do get pretty hot. Other SSD not slow? Try and reinstall the other one, but they are common to die when liquid gets on them.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 liquid damaga
threads.message:
oke, both indeed get around the same temp.

other SSD was not slow.

after i got it to boot, i used the recovery funtion from the recovery tools.
it didnt clean the SSD (Lucky me because i get payed extra for saving the data)

but its instant boot now.

so fixed and saved data.

thanks duke for the swift reply
